message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

This paper deals with the task of argumentative zoning in scientific papers, which involves classifying sentences into different categories based on their argumentative function. This task is closely related to natural language processing and machine learning, which are covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. Specifically, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category as it covers topics related to natural language processing and text classification. cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.DL (Deep Learning) are also likely sub-categories as they cover topics related to machine learning and neural networks, which are used in the proposed approach.
